00039 template<typename T, bool isNumber> struct getMinMaxImpl { // fallback for unsupported types
00040     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const ValuePtr<T> &/*ref*/ ) const {
00041         LOG( Debug, error ) << "min/max computation of " << util::Value<T>::staticName() << " is not supported";
00042         return std::pair<T, T>();
00043     }
00044 };
00045 template<typename T> std::pair<T, T> calcMinMax( const T *data, size_t len )
00046 {
00047     BOOST_MPL_ASSERT_RELATION( std::numeric_limits<T>::has_denorm, != , std::denorm_indeterminate ); //well we're pretty f**ed in this case
00048     std::pair<T, T> result(
00049         std::numeric_limits<T>::max(),
00050         std::numeric_limits<T>::has_denorm ? -std::numeric_limits<T>::max() : std::numeric_limits<T>::min() //for types with denormalization min is _not_ the lowest value
00051     );
00052     LOG( Runtime, verbose_info ) << "using generic min/max computation for " << util::Value<T>::staticName();
00053 
00054     for ( const T *i = data; i < data + len; ++i ) {
00055         if(
00056             std::numeric_limits<T>::has_infinity &&
00057             ( *i == std::numeric_limits<T>::infinity() || *i == -std::numeric_limits<T>::infinity() )
00058         )
00059             continue; // skip this one if its inf
00060 
00061         if ( *i > result.second )result.second = *i; //*i is the new max if its bigger than the current (gets rid of nan as well)
00062 
00063         if ( *i < result.first )result.first = *i; //*i is the new min if its smaller than the current (gets rid of nan as well)
00064     }
00065 
00066     return result;
00067 }

00071 // specialize calcMinMax for (u)int(8,16,32)_t /
00073 
00074 template<> std::pair< uint8_t,  uint8_t> calcMinMax( const  uint8_t *data, size_t len );
00075 template<> std::pair<uint16_t, uint16_t> calcMinMax( const uint16_t *data, size_t len );
00076 template<> std::pair<uint32_t, uint32_t> calcMinMax( const uint32_t *data, size_t len );
00077 
00078 template<> std::pair< int8_t,  int8_t> calcMinMax( const  int8_t *data, size_t len );
00079 template<> std::pair<int16_t, int16_t> calcMinMax( const int16_t *data, size_t len );
00080 template<> std::pair<int32_t, int32_t> calcMinMax( const int32_t *data, size_t len );
00081 #endif //__SSE2__
00082 
00083 template<typename T> struct getMinMaxImpl<T, true> { // generic min-max for numbers (this _must_ not be run on empty ValuePtr)
00084     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const ValuePtr<T> &ref ) const {
00085         return calcMinMax( &ref[0], ref.getLength() );
00086     }
00087 };

00095 template<typename TYPE> class ValuePtrIterator: public std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag, TYPE>
00096 {
00097     TYPE *p;
00098     typedef typename std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag, TYPE>::difference_type distance;
00099     friend class ValuePtrIterator<const TYPE>;
00100 public:
00101     ValuePtrIterator(): p( NULL ) {}
00102     ValuePtrIterator( TYPE *_p ): p( _p ) {}
00103     ValuePtrIterator( const ValuePtrIterator<typename boost::remove_const<TYPE>::type > &src ): p( src.p ) {}
00104 
00105     ValuePtrIterator<TYPE>& operator++() {++p; return *this;}
00106     ValuePtrIterator<TYPE>& operator--() {--p; return *this;}
00107 
00108     ValuePtrIterator<TYPE>  operator++( int ) {ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> tmp = *this; ++*this; return tmp;}
00109     ValuePtrIterator<TYPE>  operator--( int ) {ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> tmp = *this; --*this; return tmp;}
00110 
00111     TYPE &operator*() const { return *p; }
00112     TYPE *operator->() const { return p; }
00113 
00114     bool operator==( const ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> &cmp )const {return p == cmp.p;}
00115     bool operator!=( const ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> &cmp )const {return !( *this == cmp );}
00116 
00117     bool operator>( const ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> &cmp )const {return p > cmp.p;}
00118     bool operator<( const ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> &cmp )const {return p < cmp.p;}
00119 
00120     bool operator>=( const ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> &cmp )const {return p >= cmp.p;}
00121     bool operator<=( const ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> &cmp )const {return p <= cmp.p;}
00122 
00123     ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> operator+( distance n )const {return ValuePtrIterator<TYPE>( p + n );}
00124     ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> operator-( distance n )const {return ValuePtrIterator<TYPE>( p - n );}
00125 
00126     distance operator-( const ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> &cmp )const {return p - cmp.p;}
00127 
00128     ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> &operator+=( distance n ) {p += n; return *this;}
00129     ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> &operator-=( distance n ) {p -= n; return *this;}
00130 
00131     TYPE &operator[]( distance n )const {return *( p + n );}
00132 };

00144 template<typename TYPE> class ValuePtr: public _internal::ValuePtrBase
00145 {
00146     boost::shared_ptr<TYPE> m_val;
00147     static const util::ValueReference getValueFrom( const void *p ) {
00148         return util::Value<TYPE>( *reinterpret_cast<const TYPE *>( p ) );
00149     }
00150     static void setValueInto( void *p, const util::_internal::ValueBase &val ) {
00151         *reinterpret_cast<TYPE *>( p ) = val.as<TYPE>();
00152     }
00153 protected:
00154     ValuePtr() {} // should only be used by child classed who initialize the pointer them self
00155     ValuePtrBase *clone() const {
00156         return new ValuePtr( *this );
00157     }
00158 public:
00159     typedef _internal::ValuePtrIterator<TYPE> iterator;
00160     typedef _internal::ValuePtrIterator<const TYPE> const_iterator;
00161     typedef typename iterator::reference reference;
00162     typedef typename const_iterator::reference const_reference;
00163 
00164     static const unsigned short staticID = util::_internal::TypeID<TYPE>::value << 8;
00166     struct NonDeleter {
00167         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00168             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of uint8_t it will try to print the "string"
00169             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Not freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00170         };
00171     };
00173     struct BasicDeleter {
00174         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00175             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of uint8_t it will try to print the "string"
00176             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00177             free( p );
00178         };
00179     };
00186     ValuePtr( size_t length ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ) {
00187         if( length )
00188             m_val.reset( ( TYPE * )calloc( length, sizeof( TYPE ) ), BasicDeleter() );
00189 
00190         LOG_IF( length == 0, Debug, warning )
00191                 << "Creating an empty ValuePtr of type " << util::MSubject( staticName() )
00192                 << " you should overwrite it with a useful pointer before using it";
00193     }
00194 
00202     ValuePtr( const boost::shared_ptr<TYPE> &ptr, size_t length ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr ) {}
00203 
00211     ValuePtr( TYPE *const ptr, size_t length ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr, BasicDeleter() ) {}
00212 
00223     template<typename D> ValuePtr( TYPE *const ptr, size_t length, D d ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr, d ) {}
00224 
00225     virtual ~ValuePtr() {}
00226 
00227     boost::shared_ptr<const void> getRawAddress( size_t offset = 0 )const {
00228         if( offset ) {
00229             DelProxy proxy( *this );
00230             const uint8_t *const b_ptr = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>( m_val.get() ) + offset;
00231             return boost::shared_ptr<const void>( b_ptr, proxy );
00232         } else
00233             return boost::static_pointer_cast<const void>( m_val );
00234     }
00235     boost::shared_ptr<void> getRawAddress( size_t offset = 0 ) { // use the const version and cast away the const
00236         return boost::const_pointer_cast<void>( const_cast<const ValuePtr *>( this )->getRawAddress( offset ) );
00237     }
00238     virtual value_iterator beginGeneric() {
00239         return value_iterator( ( uint8_t * )m_val.get(), ( uint8_t * )m_val.get(), bytesPerElem(), getValueFrom, setValueInto );
00240     }
00241     virtual const_value_iterator beginGeneric()const {
00242         return const_value_iterator( ( uint8_t * )m_val.get(), ( uint8_t * )m_val.get(), bytesPerElem(), getValueFrom, setValueInto );
00243     }
00244 
00245     iterator begin() {return iterator( m_val.get() );}
00246     iterator end() {return begin() + m_len;};
00247     const_iterator begin()const {return const_iterator( m_val.get() );}
00248     const_iterator end()const {return begin() + m_len;}
00249 
00251     virtual std::string toString( bool labeled = false )const {
00252         std::string ret;
00253 
00254         if ( m_len ) {
00255             // if you get trouble with to_tm here include <boost/date_time/gregorian/gregorian.hpp> or <boost/date_time/posix_time/posix_time.hpp> in your cpp
00256             for ( const_iterator i = begin(); i < end() - 1; i++ )
00257                 ret += util::Value<TYPE>( *i ).toString( false ) + "|";
00258 
00259 
00260             ret += util::Value<TYPE>( *( end() - 1 ) ).toString( labeled );
00261         }
00262 
00263         return boost::lexical_cast<std::string>( m_len ) + "#" + ret;
00264     }

00269     bool isInteger() const {return boost::is_integral< TYPE >::value;}

00273         return std::string( util::Value<TYPE>::staticName() ) + "*";

00281     TYPE &operator[]( size_t idx ) {
00282         return begin()[idx];
00283     }
00284     const TYPE &operator[]( size_t idx )const {
00285         return begin()[idx];
00286     }
00293     operator boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>&() {return m_val;}
00294     operator const boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>&()const {return m_val;}

00296     size_t bytesPerElem()const {return sizeof( TYPE );}
00297 
00298     std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> getMinMax()const {
00299         if ( getLength() == 0 ) {
00300             LOG( Debug, error ) << "Skipping computation of min/max on an empty ValuePtr";
00301             return std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference>();
00302         } else {
00303 
00304             const std::pair<util::Value<TYPE>, util::Value<TYPE> > result = _internal::getMinMaxImpl<TYPE, boost::is_arithmetic<TYPE>::value>()( *this );
00305 
00306             return std::make_pair( util::ValueReference( result.first ), util::ValueReference( result.second ) );
00307         }
00308     }
00309 
00310     std::vector<Reference> splice( size_t size )const {
00311         if ( size >= getLength() ) {
00312             LOG( Debug, warning )
00313                     << "splicing data of the size " << getLength() << " up into blocks of the size " << size << " is kind of useless ...";
00314         }
00315 
00316         const size_t fullSplices = getLength() / size;
00317 
00318         const size_t lastSize = getLength() % size;//rest of the division - size of the last splice
00319 
00320         const size_t splices = fullSplices + ( lastSize ? 1 : 0 );
00321 
00322         std::vector<Reference> ret( splices );
00323 
00324         DelProxy proxy( *this );
00325 
00326         for ( size_t i = 0; i < fullSplices; i++ )
00327             ret[i].reset( new ValuePtr( m_val.get() + i * size, size, proxy ) );
00328 
00329         if ( lastSize )
00330             ret.back().reset( new ValuePtr( m_val.get() + fullSplices * size, lastSize, proxy ) );
00331 
00332         return ret;
00333     }
00334     //
00335     scaling_pair getScalingTo( unsigned short typeID, autoscaleOption scaleopt = autoscale )const {
00336         if( typeID == staticID && scaleopt == autoscale ) { // if id is the same and autoscale is requested
00337             static const util::Value<uint8_t> one( 1 );
00338             static const util::Value<uint8_t> zero( 0 );
00339             return std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference>( one, zero ); // the result is always 1/0
00340         } else { // get min/max and compute the scaling
00341             std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> minmax = getMinMax();
00342             assert( ! ( minmax.first.isEmpty() || minmax.second.isEmpty() ) );
00343             return ValuePtrBase::getScalingTo( typeID, minmax, scaleopt );
00344         }
00345     }
00346 };
00348 // specialisation for complex - there shall be no scaling - and we cannot compute minmax
00349 template<> scaling_pair ValuePtr<std::complex<float> >::getScalingTo( unsigned short /*typeID*/, autoscaleOption /*scaleopt*/ )const;
00350 template<> scaling_pair ValuePtr<std::complex<double> >::getScalingTo( unsigned short /*typeID*/, autoscaleOption /*scaleopt*/ )const;
00352 template<typename T> bool _internal::ValuePtrBase::is()const
00353 {
00354     util::checkType<T>();
00355     return getTypeID() == ValuePtr<T>::staticID;
00356 }
